marketNews.title: Various macro and policy updates
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia's residential property price survey indicated that primary market residential property prices in Q3 2024 grew only +1.46% year-on-year, the slowest growth since Q4 2021. The slowdown was observed across all residential categories and was driven by higher building material costs, permitting issues, high down-payment requirements, and taxation. Sales of primary-market residential properties in Q3 2024 fell -7.14% year-on-year, also across all categories. The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, said that the regulation on provincial minimum wages (UMP) will be released by the end of November 2024 or, at the latest, early December 2024. The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the government will manage natural resources more wisely, including nickel, and that production growth will no longer be the benchmark for the mining industry. This comment came days after Eramet Indonesia CEO Jerome Baudelet said the company received a 2024 sales quota that was 29% lower than forecast, a measure intended to protect local miners from falling global prices. Bahlil also cited US Geological Survey data showing Indonesia's share of global nickel reserves rising from 25% in 2022-2023 to 42% in March-April 2024. Former U.S. President Donald Trump announced that he would impose a 25% import tariff on Mexico and Canada and an additional 10% tariff on China on his first day in office, aiming to curb illegal immigration and drug smuggling, a move that could heighten tensions with the three largest U.S. trading partners. The Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, said Apple Inc.'s proposal to invest USD 100 million in Indonesia does not meet fairness principles, indicating that further negotiations are needed before lifting the ban on iPhone 16 sales. He compared Appleâ€™s investment of more than IDR 244 trillion in Vietnam, which supports about 1.5 million units, to the roughly IDR 1.5 trillion invested in Indonesia for about 2.5 million units. Israeli media Haaretz reported that the Israeli cabinet will meet to discuss a 60-day cease-fire agreement with Hezbollah, which would include the withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and the pull-back of Hezbollah militias from the Israel-Lebanon border.

tickerNews.title: UNVR sells ice-cream business for IDR 7 trillion
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) announced that it has signed an agreement on 22 November 2024 with PT Magnum Ice Cream Indonesia to sell its ice-cream business for IDR 7 trillion, excluding VAT. The transaction value includes a fixed-asset market value of IDR 2.55 trillion, a net book value as of September 2024 of IDR 1.99 trillion, and inventory value as of September 2024 of IDR 172.8 billion. At the signing date, the buyer had an affiliate relationship with UNVR because both ultimate parent companies are Unilever plc. However, at the time of execution and settlement, the buyer will no longer have an affiliate relationship with UNVR. UNVR stated that the divestiture is part of Unilever's global plan to separate its ice-cream business. The sale allows UNVR to realize the value of its Indonesian ice-cream assets and return that value to shareholders in the short term, while refocusing on its remaining core businesses to enhance long-term shareholder value. The transaction will be discussed at the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) and the Independent RUPS, although dates have not yet been announced. Further details will be disclosed together with the RUPS announcements. Key Takeaway: We view the divestiture positively. Valuation-wise, the deal reflects a premium with a price-to-book (P/BV) multiple of 3.2x, well above Campina Ice Cream's (CAMP) P/BV of 1.75x. The implied price-to-earnings (P/E) range is about 22-35x, higher than UNVR's overall FY23 P/E of 15x and the annualized 9M24 P/E of 18.2x. The divestiture could enable UNVR to focus on its core operations and generate efficiency gains, especially given recent weaker performance. UNVR may also issue a special dividend from the pre-tax profit of approximately IDR 4.8 trillion from the sale. On the downside, UNVR risks losing a business with good growth potential, but limited information on the ice-cream segment's track record prevents further comment.

tickerNews.title: ANTM studies acquisition of gold mines; boosts nickel and bauxite exploration
tickerNews.content: General Manager of the Geomin Unit of Aneka Tambang (ANTM), Abdul Bari, said that the company is evaluating opportunities to acquire new gold mines both domestically and abroad. He also stated that ANTM will increase its exploration activities for nickel, gold, and bauxite over the next five years with an exploration budget of USD 723 million (approximately IDR 11.2 trillion) through 2029. The expansion is driven by a request from MIND ID to raise the company's National Resources Ownership (NRO) to 15-20% for nickel, gold, and bauxite reserves. Currently, ANTM's NRO for gold is only 0.2% of the national resource potential, while NRO for nickel and bauxite are 10% and 4% respectively.

tickerNews.title: IPCC announces interim dividend for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal (IPCC) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 44.4 billion, or IDR 24.4 per share. The dividend is cum-date on the regular market and will be tradable on 3 December 2024, with payment scheduled for 23 December 2024. Based on IPCC's closing price of IDR 750 per share on Tuesday, 26 November 2024, the implied dividend yield is approximately 3.3%.

tickerNews.title: NICL declares interim dividend for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: PAM Mineral (NICL) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 95.7 billion, or IDR 9 per share. The dividend is cum-date on the regular market and will be tradable on 5 December 2024, with payment scheduled for 16 December 2024. Based on NICL's closing price of IDR 306 per share on Tuesday, 26 November 2024, the implied dividend yield is approximately 2.9%.

tickerNews.title: WIKA secures new contracts worth about IDR 17 trillion in 10M24
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) reported new contract values of approximately IDR 17 trillion for the ten-month period ending October 2024, a 24% year-on-year decline, representing 46% of the 2024 target of IDR 37 trillion. Of the new contracts, 39.75% originated from infrastructure and building segments, followed by industry (32.84%), realty and property (14.18%), and energy and industrial plant (13.22%). Private sector contributions accounted for 44.21% of the total new contract value, government for 31.44%, state-owned enterprises for 23.92%, and investment for 0.43%.

tickerNews.title: SMIL director Hadi Suhermin purchases 27 million shares
tickerNews.content: Hadi Suhermin, the controlling shareholder and President Director of Sarana Mitra Luas (SMIL), bought 27 million SMIL shares at IDR 185 per share on 22 November 2024. The transaction value was approximately IDR 5 billion. After the purchase, Suhermin's ownership increased from 49% to 49.3%.

tickerNews.title: AMAN secures IDR 50 billion investment for Halal Industrial Park
tickerNews.content: Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN) announced that its Halal Industrial Park in Sidoarjo received an investment of IDR 50 billion from cargo storage company Super Dry Marine. Director Adi Teja Surya said the park aims to attract total investments of IDR 97.8 trillion by 2045.

tickerNews.title: WSKT seeks bond restructuring to lift trading suspension
tickerNews.content: Waskita Karya (WSKT) stated that it will seek approval for the restructuring of Sustainable Bond III Stage IV 2019 Series B, with a principal amount of IDR 1.36 trillion, in order to have its shares released from the trading suspension imposed by the IDX since 8 May 2023. This bond is the only non-guaranteed bond that has not yet been restructured due to the need for consent from the largest bondholder in the series. WSKT will hold a bondholders' meeting on 12 December 2024 to request approval for the restructuring.

tickerNews.title: ARTO director resigns effective 31 December 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank Jago (ARTO) announced that Peterjan van Nieuwenhuizen has submitted his resignation as a director of the company, effective 31 December 2024. The resignation will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 17 December 2024. The meeting will also consider the resignation of independent commissioner Teguh Dartanto and the appointment of Mahdi Syahbuddin as an independent commissioner.
